programme.title: Paranormal: Caught On Camera: Top 100
programme.desc: ...Camera - Top 100. A collection of standout videos from season one, showcasing the most chilling and unexplainable paranormal activity footage captured by eyewitnesses. (S1, ep 2)

programme.title: National Park Mysteries
programme.desc: Great Smokey Mountains National Park: A stroll through a national park that is the alleged underground base for a powerful secret society. (S2, ep 5)

programme.title: National Park Mysteries
programme.desc: Mark Twain National Forest: Some claim that the dark, mysterious energies that surround this national park point to treasures from a lost civilisation that are hidden there. (S2, ep 6)

programme.title: Encounter: UFO
programme.desc: Sometimes, the mysterious unidentified objects people see in the sky touch down and leave physical evidence behind. (S1, ep 6)

programme.title: Mega Disasters 3
programme.desc: Noah's Great Flood: Could the biblical story of Noah be true? When oceans surged 8,000 years ago, water burst through the Bosporus Strait with catastrophic effects. (S3, ep 3)

programme.title: Mega Disasters 3
programme.desc: Volcanic Winter: When the largest volcanic eruption of the past two million years occurred 75,000 years ago, a shield of debris formed and deflected the sun's rays. (S3, ep 5)

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: Join antiques expert and presenter David Dickinson as more collectors try to sell their items to dealers. Will they strike a deal or take a chance at auction instead? (S8, ep 59)

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Slice And Dice: When someone brings in an antique key gun, can the Pawn Stars unlock the mystery behind it? Then, a rare 1600s blade slices its way into the shop. (S1, ep 18)

programme.title: Container Wars
programme.desc: Day Late and a Dollar Short: Four containers are auctioned after their holiday deadline passes, Uzi gets a fright and an enigmatic logo could lead to a cash windfall. (S2, ep 12)

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Underwater in Hawaii: The bidders take a trip out to Hawaii for an auction at a marine life park. (S4, ep 13)

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Built for Speed: Buyers battle to score an item that appears to be a covered car. But when the tarp is pulled back, will the winner drive away with cash or trash? (S1, ep 17)

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Estate Sale: Ashley and Les head off to a huge estate sale, Seth takes a custom Corvette go-kart for a spin and Karen eyes up a piece of `70s movie memorabilia. (S13, ep 6)

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Professor Les: Les gets invited to give a lecture at a local business school. Meanwhile, Ashley and Bobby J go to war over a collection of Nerf guns. (S13, ep 7)

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: War On The Floor: Les questions Ashley's management skills when two employees get into a fight on the shop floor. Meanwhile, Seth stumbles upon a potentially huge deal. (S13, ep 8)

programme.title: UFOs: The Lost Evidence
programme.desc: Police UFO Files: Using archival recordings, transcripts and incident reports, UFO researchers investigate what really happened during incredible encounters with UFOs. (S2, ep 5)

programme.title: Curse Of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: Shocking Revelations: The team get an otherworldly surprise as they shoot electricity into the soil of Skinwalker Ranch using high-powered Tesla Coils. (S2, ep 8)

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.desc: Witch's Broomstick, UFOs Vs. Volcanoes, and Oakville Blobs: The team investigate footage of a witch's broomstick, extraterrestrial goings-on and blobs falling from the sky. (S3, ep 7)

programme.title: World's Greatest Treasure Mysteries
programme.desc: Return to Poverty Island: Taking a new approach, Rick and Matty return to Poverty Island in Lake Michigan to search for missing Civil War gold. (S3, ep 4)

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Million Dollar Deal: A signed letter from a former president has Rick and Corey singing Sammy Davis Jr's praises. Then, a giant bird egg rolls into Rick's coop. (S1, ep 19)

programme.desc: Henry and Sam start at Bristol Classic Car Show, where they acquire a quirky car from the 1970s. (S1, ep 1)

programme.desc: A Launch Party and a Whole Human Being: The Coopers can't be found as Mandy goes into labour, and Sheldon is excited about the launch of his database. (S6 Ep14)

programme.title: Married at First Sight Australia
programme.desc: Brand new series: As a tumultuous week of meeting friends and families comes to an end, the fourth and most intense Commitment Ceremony of the experiment arrives. (S12 Ep21)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Cooper-Hofstadter Polarization: Sheldon and Leonard fall out when they're asked to collaborate at a physics conference. Penny tries to help but just makes things worse. (S1 Ep9)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Loobenfeld Decay: Leonard and Sheldon each tell a lie to avoid going to see Penny singing on stage in a production of Rent, but Sheldon's fib gets out of control. (S1 Ep10)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Pancake Batter Anomaly: Penny volunteers to nurse Sheldon when he's sick. But his friends, who know how miserable he is when he's ill, stay well away. (S1 Ep11)

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Wiener Schnitzel and Underwear in a Tree: The new and final series commences! In the first episode, news of the tornado reaches Sheldon and Mary in Germany. (S7 Ep1)

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Roulette Wheel and a Piano Playing Dog: Sheldon realises that he's the weakest student in his class, and Meemaw sets out to expand her gambling business. (S7 Ep2)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Strangers on a Treadmill: Claire and Mitchell help each other spare their partners from embarrassment - Cameron from wardrobe choices, and Phil from his estate agents' speech. (S2 Ep4)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Unplugged: Claire and Phil challenge the family to a digital detox contest. (S2 Ep5)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Waverly Hills, 9-0-2-1-D'oh: The family rent a flat in the affluent Waverly Hills area so that Bart and Lisa can get into a good school. (S20 Ep19/21)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Four Great Women and a Manicure: On a visit to the nail salon, Marge and Lisa discuss whether a woman can be simultaneously clever, powerful and beautiful. (S20 Ep20/21)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Panty Piñata Polarization: Sheldon bans Penny from the flat for numerous minor infractions, so she retaliates. Howard and Raj search for the America's Next Top Model house. (S2 Ep7)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Lizard-Spock Expansion: Howard is furious when a woman who he likes falls for Leonard instead, despite Howard's efforts to woo her. (S2 Ep8)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The White Asparagus Triangulation: Sheldon is delighted that Leonard has finally found a girlfriend who matches up to his high standards... Perhaps a little too delighted. (S2 Ep9/23)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Simpsons Spin-Off Showcase: Troy McClure hosts a vision of the future of The Simpsons, in which Chief Wiggum becomes private detective Wiggum, P.I. (S8 Ep24/25)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Rex continues to fight his conscience, while a fearful Sienna frantically tries to put things in order. And a party ends in disaster, but things are about to get worse for one resident...

programme.title: New: Married at First Sight...
programme.desc: ...Australia: Brand new series: It's time for the Couples Retreat in Byron Bay. But one bride storms out, and one groom is left questioning who he can trust. (S12 Ep22)

programme.title: Love Cheats: The Fireman Fraudster
programme.desc: True crime documentary. The dramatic story of twin sisters defrauded by a sinister con artist who masqueraded as a generous, fun-loving firefighter but wasn't such a hero after all. (Ep2/4)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The Goggleboxers tune in to Bridgerton, SAS: Who Dares Wins, Freeze the Fear with Wim Hof, Made in Chelsea, and the news on Rishi Sunak and the Partygate scandal. (S19 Ep9)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Gamer Lauren is looking for her perfect player number two to help her reboot her love life. And Ryan is searching for a silver fox with a dad bod. (S11 Ep4)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Singleton Nicole's friends call her Bridget Jones. At first glance, chartered surveyor Gary is no Mr Darcy, but will his karaoke skills impress Nicole? (S5 Ep2) [SL]

programme.title: PL: United v Man City 94/95
programme.desc: United Archives 10/11/94. A classic derby encounter as Brian Horton brought his team across the city to Old Trafford.

programme.title: PL: United v Ipswich 94/95
programme.desc: United Archives 4/3/95. An amazing goal-fest at the Theatre of Dreams in March 95 as Andy Cole scored five times in an historic 9-0 victory over Ipswich Town.

programme.title: PL: Bolton v United 95/96
programme.desc: United Archives 25/2/96. With a huge trip to Newcastle looming, United looked to keep the pressure on at the top by beating struggling Bolton.

programme.title: PL: United v Nottm Forest 95/96
programme.desc: United Archives 28/4/96. United ended their home campaign against Nottingham Forest, knowing that a win would take them to the brink of the Premiership title.

programme.title: PL: United v Sunderland 96/97
programme.desc: United Archives 21/12/96. United took on Sunderland for the first time in the Premier League on what was to be a memorable afternoon at the Theatre of Dreams.

programme.title: PL: Nottm Forest v United 98/99
programme.desc: United Archives 6/2/99. Former United boss Ron Atkinson was hoping to get one over his old club when they visited the City Ground with Forest deep in relegation trouble.

programme.title: PL: United v Bradford 00/01
programme.desc: United Archives 5/9/00. United battered the Bantams in impressive style with Teddy Sheringham and Quinton Fortune hitting a brace each.

programme.title: PL: United v Southampton 00/01
programme.desc: United Archives 28/10/00. United welcomed struggling Southampton looking to keep up their scintillating home form, having scored 22 goals in their opening six league contests at the Theatre of Dreams.

programme.title: PL: United v Arsenal 00/01
programme.desc: United Archives 25/2/01. United welcomed Arsenal knowing that victory would move them closer to securing a third consecutive Premiership crown.

programme.title: PL: United v Derby 01/02
programme.desc: United Archives 12/12/2001. After 3 Successive League defeats, United hoped to rediscover their form at home to Derby.

programme.title: PL United v Southampton 01/02
programme.desc: United Archives 22/12/01. Sir Alex's side took on Southampton with the visitors looking for their first win at Old Trafford since January 1988.

programme.title: PL: United v Blackburn 10/11
programme.desc: United Archives 27/11/10. The Reds looked to make it 20 Premier League games unbeaten as they welcomed Big Sam's Blackburn to Old Trafford.

programme.title: Phallon Tullis-Joyce: Season Review
programme.desc: Phallon Tullis-Joyce looks back at some of her best saves from the season so far.

programme.title: PL: United v Newcastle 07/08
programme.desc: United Archives 12/1/08. An uneventful first half is quickly forgotten about when United put Newcastle to the sword in the final 45.

programme.title: PL: United v Arsenal 11/12
programme.desc: United Archives 28/8/11. The Reds welcomed an Arsenal side who had made a slow start to the season. With the Gunners hampered by injuries and suspensions, could Sir Alex's men take advantage?

programme.title: PL: Bolton v United 11/12
programme.desc: United Archives 10/9/11. United enjoyed a stellar start to the 2011/12 season, underlined at The Reebok Stadium with a 5 star performance against Bolton.

programme.title: Monster High
programme.desc: Clawdeen finds she has a lot in common with her dad in 'Werewolf Weekend', then in 'That Thing You Deuce', Deuce overworks himself to win a fundraiser, turning other students into sweets. (S1, ep 5)

programme.title: Monster High
programme.desc: Paw-zzle Pieces: To discover the cause of her mother's disappearances, Clawdeen opens a portal in the Monster High catacombs and releases... her brother Clawd? (S1, ep 6)

programme.title: The Loud House
programme.desc: Lola learns that Lana is planning their joint birthday in 'Strife of the Party', then in 'Kernel of Truth', Lincoln and the School Action News Team solve the mystery of the missing popcorn. (S5, ep 4)

programme.title: The Loud House
programme.desc: Lisa discovers Flip is a marvel of modern science in 'Blinded by Science', then in 'Band Together', Luna has to decide between band with her friends or with professionals. (S5, ep 6)

programme.title: The Loud House
programme.desc: Lynn pushes Liam to his limits in 'Cow Pie Kid', then in 'Saved by the Spell', Lincoln's friends try to stop him from performing a magic act at the middle school talent show. (S5, ep 7)

programme.title: LEGO City Adventures
programme.desc: Maddy becomes an intrepid reporter in 'Quantifying Intrepidness', and in 'Green Light', Fendrich tries to steal a high-tech Eco-Power device. Wheeler sends the reluctant Alan to stop him. (S3, ep 7)

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: Papa Smurf appoints Rescue Smurfs in 'The Majestic 5', then in 'Kitchen Klutz', After Clumsy saves Chef's life, Chef takes Clumsy on as his assistant in the kitchen. It's a catastrophe. (S1, ep 11)

programme.title: 44 Cats
programme.desc: Granny Pina's Birthday: Several birds that were outside in the rain are welcomed into the house by the Buffycats, but they begin to cause a series of disasters on Granny Pina's birthday! (S2, ep 25)

programme.title: 44 Cats
programme.desc: The Cat-fu Show: Meow-Paw, Milady's grandpa, comes to visit her in view of the traditional Cat-fu Day show. The Buffycats are all enthusiastic and Milady wants to give her best. (S2, ep 26)

programme.title: 44 Cats
programme.desc: Whisker Twister: Tired of playing Yarn Hoops, the Buffycats decide to make a Cat Swap, exchanging for other games. But after exchanging various objects, they're back to square one. (S2, ep 27)

programme.title: Best & Bester
programme.desc: Bester struggles to get her brother's attention in 'The Big Game', then in 'Get Your Skate On', Best and Bester stage a stunt for Grafifi's shop which has everyone fearing for their lives. (S1, ep 3)

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: Patrick's big sister Samantha comes for a visit in 'Big Sister Sam', and then in 'Perfect Chemistry', Sandy and Plankton bond over their shared love of science.

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: When Squidward is hurt on the job, he threatens to sue Mr. Krabs in 'Accidents Will Happen', and in 'The Other Patty', Mr. Krabs and Plankton find a common enemy in the new 'Flabby Patty' restaurant.

programme.title: ALVINNN!!! and the Chipmunks
programme.desc: Sister Act: Following a fight with Brittany, Eleanor decides to move in. Alvin panics! Their "bro zone" has been invaded! Alvin and his brothers decide it's time to strike back. (S1, ep 5)

programme.title: ALVINNN!!! and the Chipmunks
programme.desc: Carts and Crafts: When Alvin inadvertently destroys Theodore's bicycle, he enters the boys in a roundup of shopping carts where the first prize is a new bike. (S1, ep 34)

programme.title: ALVINNN!!! and the Chipmunks
programme.desc: Brittany the Body Snatcher: When Alvin notices Brittany being nice to him he's sure an alien has taken over her body.

programme.title: ALVINNN!!! and the Chipmunks

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: Sandy gives her friends special saltwater trees in 'Arbor Day Disarray', then in 'Ain't That The Tooth', SpongeBob and Patrick mistake a burglar for the tooth fairy.

programme.desc: Crash Training Course: Grizzy finds a gadget that enables you to learn anything. He can now become the perfect bear! But first, he needs to learn how to get rid of the Lemmings. (S1 Ep54)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: As Far as Bear Can Remember: An old metal box found by chance brings back childhood memories for Grizzy and the Lemmings. They recall the first time they met, when they were still kids. (S1 Ep55)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Chemical Lemmings: How can Grizzy watch a documentary on salmon fish, nice and comfy on the sofa, when the Lemmings are playing chemistry novices with a fun experiment box? (S1 Ep56)

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.desc: Remote Control: Grizzy's TV remote control is stolen by a partridge who collects high-tech objects in his nest perched high up in a tree. (S1 Ep57)

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.desc: The Bear and the Butterfly: Grizzy wants to offer a butterfly to the she-bear he's in love with. But the Lemmings fight with him over the rare specimens he's spotted. (S1 Ep58)

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.desc: Get Off My Tennis Shoes: The Lemmings find a pack of icy mints that literally chill your breath. One blast from anyone who eats them freezes everything in sight! (S1 Ep59)

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.desc: Babysitting: Grizzy babysits for the bear he has a crush on. There's no question of Grizzy tripping up, for he has no intention of taking any risks! (S1 Ep60)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Bear Under Lock and Key: Unwilling to share the food both he and the Lemmings are wild about, Grizzy locks it up inside the ranger's brand new and apparently burglar-proof safe. (S1 Ep61)

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.desc: Lemming Blues: Grizzy is impressed by the TV show of a magician who transforms a partridge into a bouquet of flowers. (S1 Ep62)

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.desc: Snow Lemmings: Grizzy craves ice cream on a hot day, but the Lemmings have used strawberry-vanilla ice cream to create a sled run in the backyard. (S1 Ep63)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Quiche it Goodbye: When an 'evil conglomerate' is threatening to take over Chef's favourite childhood restaurant, Owen rallies the kids to take them down. (S3 Ep25)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Ice Guys Finish Last: Chef brings a souvenir iceberg home from a trip to the South Pole and Duncan finds a prehistoric surprise inside. (S3 Ep26)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Gwen Scary, Gwen Lost - Part 1: When Chef discovers his spooky Halloween pranks have never scared the kids, he's devastated, and agrees to hand over full control of his pranking to Gwen. (S3 Ep27)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Gwen Scary, Gwen Lost - Part 2: Gwen's plan turns out far spookier than Chef ever hoped. (S3 Ep28)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Trousering Inferno: The Bad Guy Busters must reunite to save Izzy after Harold uncovers her previous identity and leads a super villain from her past right to her. (S3 Ep29)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: The Big Bangs Theory: Chef forgets the password for his computer, but knows it has something to do with one of the 99 previous explosions that took out the school. (S3 Ep30)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Mad Math: Taffy Road: After Courtney refuses to share her taffy winnings from a 'calculus for candy' competition, she's transported to a desolate future. (S3 Ep31)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Bearly Edible: After eating snacks meant for everyone and replacing them with disgusting low budget cookies from Barfvomita, Owen is full of guilt and tries to make things right. (S3 Ep32)

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.desc: Sniffer Sniffler Raccoon: Grizzy's last jar of chocolate spread has been pinched by the Lemmings, who are savouring it in secret. (S1 Ep67)

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.desc: Transformational Bear: Grizzy uses the Lemmings' radio-controlled toy robot as a butler. (S1 Ep68)

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.desc: Shaken-Up Bear: The vibrations created by Grizzy's snoring during his nap give the Lemmings an idea for a bouncing game. (S1 Ep69)

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.desc: Piñata Party: Grizzy finds a birthday piñata in the ranger's living room. (S1 Ep70)

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.desc: Bear Game: Grizzy and the Lemmings discover a magical Game of the Goose. The events displayed in the squares that the players land on come true in real life. (S1 Ep71)

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.desc: Ranger Lemming: Grizzy is bothered by an object stuck in between the sofa cushions: a big fur lemming puppet glove. (S1 Ep72)

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.desc: Halloween Bear: Grizzy discovers the leftovers of a Halloween party in the ranger's cabin and carries on the party with the Lemmings. (S1 Ep73)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Clean Bear: Grizzy wants to give she-bear a plastic ring. But since it was found in the trash, he needs to wash it first, and the Lemmings are using the only bar of soap in the house! (S1 Ep74)

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.desc: Wandering Spirits: Grizzy finds a strange figurine with the power to switch the spirits of two living beings and finds himself imprisoned in the body of a caribou. (S1 Ep75)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Space Codyty: Izzy, convinced that Cody is an alien, embarks on a journey through space to take him back home. (S2 Ep38)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Gobble Head: Chef accidentally cooks up a killer cyborg turkey in a failed attempt to get the kids to appreciate him on Appreciation Day. (S2 Ep39)

programme.title: Mermicorno: Starfall
programme.desc: Ghost Town: The Mermicornos stumble across an eerie ghost town, where there's a shocking revelation about Gwen's past - and her present. (S1 Ep3)

programme.title: Unicorn Academy
programme.desc: The Hidden Temple: While riding the Skyberry Trail, Wildstar gets spooked by grim magic, sending the group racing to a long-forgotten temple full of mysteries - and danger. (S1 Ep1)

programme.title: Rainbow Butterfly Unicorn Kitty
programme.desc: Merry Mythmas - Part 1: When Santa Paws takes the year off, Felicity is chosen to replace him and deliver the Mythmas presents to all of Mythlandia. (S1 Ep15)

programme.title: Rainbow Butterfly Unicorn Kitty
programme.desc: Merry Mythmas - Part 2: Rudy teams up with Timmy the Kraken to try and ruin Mythmas, so it's up to Felicity and her friends to save the day. (S1 Ep16)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Space Codyty: Izzy, convinced that Cody is an alien, embarks on a journey through space to take him back home. (S2 Ep38)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Gobble Head: Chef accidentally cooks up a killer cyborg turkey in a failed attempt to get the kids to appreciate him on Appreciation Day. (S2 Ep39)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Snack To The Future: Owen wants his favourite treat, 'Jiggle Giggle', so bad that he's uses a time machine to get to snack time quicker. (S2 Ep40)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Me, My Elf, And I: Duncan tricks Chef into taking the class to the North Pole to remove his name from the naughty list. (S2 Ep41)

programme.title: Mermicorno: Starfall
programme.desc: Dance, Magic, Dance!: Forced to take refuge in the Creepy Kelp Forest, the Mermicornos find themselves at the mercy of the mischievous Water Sprites. (S1 Ep4)

programme.title: Unicorn Academy
programme.desc: The Race: Miss Primrose accelerates the students' training by sending them to an advanced obstacle course. But will competition get in the way? (S1 Ep2)

programme.title: Rainbow Butterfly Unicorn Kitty
programme.desc: The Boaracle: The Boaracle, a boar who claims to predict the future, makes a series of predictions about Miguel that all come true. (S1 Ep25)

programme.title: Rainbow Butterfly Unicorn Kitty
programme.desc: Out Of The Box: When Felicity goes viral doing fun unboxing videos, a jealous Rudy slips Pandora's Box into her scratching post house. (S1 Ep26)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Bad Seed: Chef introduces the kids to agriculture by teaching them how to grow plants from seeds. But when Izzy shows her seed too much love, it turns into a monster! (S2 Ep44)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: A Fish Called Leshawna: After eating some mystery fish sticks, Leshawna achieves every little girl's dream and transforms into a mermaid! (S2 Ep45)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Double Oh Beth: With most of the class already gone for spring break, a villain infiltrates the school. Luckily a sleeper agent has been lying in wait. Hold on... it's Beth?!? Oh boy... (S2 Ep46)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Duncan Duty: When Duncan realises Chef is getting kids to tattle on him in return for chocolate milk, he sees an opportunity. (S2 Ep47)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Encore'tney: When Courtney turns to a magical datebook to help her achieve perfection, she's trapped in a never-ending loop until a friend teaches her a valuable lesson. (S2 Ep48)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Life Of Pie: When Izzy, Jude and Owen accidentally bring a pizza to life they do everything they can to help it find a new purpose in life, other than being eaten. (S2 Ep49)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Abaracaduncan: When a magic trick goes sideways, Duncan makes a great escape and Harold becomes the target of a Sorcerer Hunt! (S2 Ep50)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Shock & Aww: When Courtney gets the old, gross daycare carpet replaced with a new one, the resulting static electricity has unexpected consequences. (S2 Ep51)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: School District 9: When a career-predicting machine tells Owen he has no skills to offer the world, Owen finds a way to prove the machine wrong in the most Owen way possible. (S2 Ep52)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Gumbearable: After accidentally swallowing a piece of gum, Owen has to protect his friends by jumping into a gum volcano. (S3 Ep1)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Whack Mirror: Chef warns Beth and Cody that making goofy faces into a mirror will cause them to get stuck that way. It turns out he was right, just not in the way any of them ever imagined. (S3 Ep2)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Broken Back Kotter: Izzy nominates Chef for the Daycare Professional of the Year award and will do whatever it takes to see him win. As it turns out, it takes a lot. (S3 Ep3)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Way Back Wendel: Courtney must deliberately lose a challenge or let the entire world go back in time. It's a hard choice for her. (S2 Ep29)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Stingin' In The Rain: When Chef gets locked outside during a storm, the kids mistakenly assume he's a robber and decide to protect the Daycare - by any means necessary. (S2 Ep30)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Cartoon Realism: Gwen is frustrated by Beth's silly belief that cartoons are real, but they visit an animation studio and discover that Beth is right! (S2 Ep31)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Carmageddon: Duncan is rattled when Chef, tired of having his car destroyed, buys a new one that is completely indestructible. (S3 Ep7)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Sugar & Spice & Lightning & Frights: Two new kids show up at the daycare. Duncan and Leshawna take issue with not what makes them different, but what makes them similar to the newbies. (S3 Ep8)

programme.title: Power Players
programme.desc: Bringing Up Baby: For a school assignment, Axel must take care of a plastic baby doll. Amused, Madcap brings it to life. The Power Players will have to keep the baby from causing a fuss! (S1 Ep39)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Fake Brother: Grizzy builds a lookalike robot to keep the lemmings away while he prepares a party for she-bear. But his double is not as clever as Grizzy had hoped... (S1 Ep25)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Mind in a Whirl: When she is accidentally hit over the head, the she-bear Grizzy is in love with thinks she's a lemming. (S1 Ep26)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: A Sizeable Problem: When a meteorite falls near the log cabin, strange berries start to grow. One of their properties is that they make those who eat them grow to disproportionate sizes. (S1 Ep27)

programme.title: Rainbow Butterfly Unicorn Kitty
programme.desc: The Green-Eyed Monster: Miguel invites Chippy, a cute chipmunk-like creature, to join him and Felicity on their friend-iversary, but Chippy isn't all she seems! (S1 Ep17)

programme.title: Rainbow Butterfly Unicorn Kitty
programme.desc: Nobody's Purrfect: Felicity tries a little too hard to be purrfect and somehow loses both her powers and her confidence. (S1 Ep18)

programme.title: LEGO Friends: The Next Chapter
programme.desc: Over-Leveraged Leo: Unwilling to tell his friends "No," Leo finds himself needed in three places at once during the street fair fundraiser for the new community center. (S1 Ep6)

programme.title: Patrol Pawennau

programme.title: Crawc a'i Ffrindiau

programme.title: Sigldigwt

programme.title: Heavens Above!

programme.title: The Heritage Chart Show with Mike Read
programme.desc: A TOTP style TV Show for Heritage Artists based on the Heritage Chart which is voted on in over 80 countries. Songs you love from popular artists, live and on video with the odd interview.

programme.title: The Old Barn Dance
programme.desc: 1938. Western. Directed by Joseph Kane. Stars Gene Autry, Smiley Burnette & Joan Valerie. A horse trader arrives in a small town, but soon becomes the rival of a powerful tractor manufacturer. [S]

programme.title: Action Stations
programme.desc: 1957. Drama. Directed by Cecil H. Williamson and starring Paul Carpenter and Mary Martin. A forger flees to Spain but his daughter is kidnapped by a gang. [S]

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: The Marshal of Yellow Jacket. 1959. Stars Rory Calhoun, Robert J. Wilke & John Beradino. Bill Longley clashes with a greedy marshal whilst in the town of Yellow Jacket. [S]

programme.title: The Larkins
programme.desc: Café Ole. 1963. Stars David Kossoff, Hugh Paddick & John Bluthal. Now the kids have gone, Ada and Alf are running a café, their lodger suggests they run a Spanish night, but will it be a success? [S]

programme.title: Salute the Toff
programme.desc: 1952. Drama. Director: Maclean Rogers. Stars John Bentley and Carol Marsh. Based on the 1941 Novel. The sixth in the series featuring upper-class sleuth, Richard Rollison. [S]

programme.title: Who Goes Next
programme.desc: 1938. War. Director: Maurice Elvey. Stars Barry K. Barnes, Sophie Stewart & Jack Hawkins. During World War One, a number of captured British officers attempt to escape a prisoner-of-war camp. [S]

programme.title: Look At Life Chinatown
programme.desc: 1968. A wonderful look at the world of the Chinese who have made Britain their home, and in particular London's 'Chinatown'.

programme.title: Night Of The Prowler
programme.desc: 1962. Crime Drama. Directed by Francis Searle. When the director of a successful racing company is shot dead, the other directors wonder who is next. Starring Bill Nagy & Patrick Holt. [S]

programme.title: Glad Tidings
programme.desc: 1953. Drama. Colonel's adult children object to him marrying an American widow. Starring Barbara Kelly and Raymond Huntley. [S]

programme.title: Do You Know This Voice?
programme.desc: 1964. Drama. Directed by Frank Nesbitt. Stars Dan Duryea, Isa Miranda, Gwen Watford & Peter Madden. In this great murder mystery, the only clue to the killer's identity is his shoes! [S]

programme.title: Four Star Playhouse: The Wallet
programme.desc: 1954. Drama. Directed by Robert Florey. Stars Charles Boyer & Maria Palmer. A waiter with more pride than money takes a wealthy customer's forgotten wallet to get his sick wife good medical care. [S]

programme.title: The Undefeated
programme.desc: 1969. Western. Director: Andrew V. McLaglen. Stars John Wayne, Rock Hudson & Antonio Aguilar. An ex-union army officer and his confederate counterpart join forces to fight Mexican revolutionaries. [S]

programme.title: The Beverly Hillbillies
programme.desc: The Clampetts Go Hollywood. 1963. Stars Buddy Ebsen, King Donovan & Shirley Mitchell. Jake and Opal continue to stay at the Clampett mansion. Jake thinks he can make a movie with Jed's money. [S]

programme.title: Scotland Yard
programme.desc: 1954. The Strange Case of Blonde. Directed by Ken Hughes. Stars Lee Sinclaire, Derek Alward, Cyril Smith & Russell Napier. A cat burglar adopts an unexpected disguise. (S1, E08)

programme.title: Dixon of Dock Green
programme.desc: A Slight Case of Love. 1975. Stars Jack Warner, Moira Redmond & Peter Hill. A group of eight businessmen want to find Kate Harris. Seven want her locked up, but the eighth has an ulterior motive. [S]

programme.title: Out of Town
programme.desc: The Shooting Master. 1986. Lock, stock and barrel Jack explains the working of his great-grandfather's shotgun. Then he visits a shooting school on a disused railway line. [S]

programme.title: The Footage Detectives
programme.desc: We're jetting off to Heathrow in 1958 and Noel's uncovered a reel about the production of newspapers in the 70s. Have you still got your Beezer Bingo Banger? And do you remember AGM potato crisps? [S]

programme.title: Public Eye
programme.desc: 1972. Detective & Mystery Drama. Girl In Blue. Stars Alfred Burke, Ray Smith & Richard Leech. Marker is hired to discover her whereabouts of a missing Janice Summers, and bring her back home. [S]

programme.title: Border Incident
programme.desc: 1949. Thriller. Directed by Anthony Mann. Stars Ricardo Montalban, George Murphy & Howard Da Silva. Two agents go undercover to stop the smuggling of Mexican migrant workers into California. [S]

programme.title: Picnic at Hanging Rock
programme.desc: 1975. Drama. Directed by Peter Weir. Stars Rachel Roberts, Anne-Louise Lambert & Vivean Gray. A school summer picnic takes an unpleasant turn when a group of students and a teacher vanish. [S]

programme.title: Picnic at Hanging Rock
programme.desc: 1975. Drama. Directed by Peter Weir. Stars Rachel Roberts, Anne-Louise Lambert & Vivean Gray. A school summer picnic takes an unpleasant turn when a group of students and a teacher vanish. [S]

programme.title: The Fourth War
programme.desc: 1990. Drama. Directed by John Frankenheimer. Stars Roy Scheider, Jürgen Prochnow & Tim Reid. On the Russian border, the murder of a defector sparks a forbidden battle between two colonels. [S]

programme.title: Three Came Home
programme.desc: 1950. True story of a woman imprisoned in several Japanese war camps. She struggles to protect her young son. Stars Claudette Colbert.

programme.title: Colonel March of Scotland Yard
programme.desc: The Case of the Kidnapped Poodle. 1956. Stars Boris Karloff, Ewan Roberts. Colonel March investigates the theft of a valuable diamond and the kidnapping of a poodle. [S]

programme.title: Dangerous Assignment
programme.desc: The Archaeological Story. 1952. Stars Brian Donlevy, Randy Stuart & Lyle Talbot. Steve travels to the Trans-Jordan area to find a missing goddess statuette and protect her from the wrong hands. [S]

programme.title: Come Back Peter
programme.desc: 1952. Comedy. Director: Charles Saunders. Stars Patrick Holt, Peter Hammond, Humphrey Lestocq & Kathleen Boutall. Pandemonium is created in a home when various relatives come to stay. [S]

programme.title: Clash By Night
programme.desc: 1963. Drama. Directed by Montgomery Tully. Starring Terence Longdon, Jennifer Jayne & Harry Fowler. A prison bus enroute to jail is hijacked by a gang determined to free their leader. [S]

programme.title: Mohawk
programme.desc: 1956. Adventure. Director: Kurt Neumann. Stars Scott Brady, Rita Gam & Neville Brand. An artist is torn between his love for two women and is thrown into the middle of a Mohawk-Iroquois-American. [S]

programme.title: The 20 Questions Murder Mystery
programme.desc: 1950. Crime. Director: Paul L. Stein. Stars Robert Beatty, Rona Anderson & Clifford Evans. Prior to committing a crime, someone sends in a question to the B.B.C.'s '20 Questions' programme. [S]

programme.title: The Strange Love of Martha Ivers
programme.desc: 1946. Drama. Director: Lewis Milestone. Stars Barbara Stanwyck, Van Heflin, Lizabeth Scott & Kirk Douglas. The relationships formed in childhood by three friends lead to murder and obsessive love. [S]

programme.title: Look At Life East of Suez
programme.desc: 1966. An intriguing look at how British troops are policing the rivers and jungles of Borneo and a glimpse of some of the problems that have to be overcome.

programme.title: The Small Voice
programme.desc: 1948. Drama. Director: Fergus McDonell. Stars. James Donald, Valerie Hobson, David Greene, Howard Keel. A couple come across a car crash, where they discover that the occupants are armed. [S]

programme.title: Mr. Beamish Goes South
programme.desc: 1953. Mystery. Directed by Oscar Burn & John Wall. Stars John Laurie & Hector Ross. An amateur detective pursues a seaside serial killer who disposes of his female victims in an acid bath. [S]

programme.title: The Edgar Wallace Mystery Theatre
programme.desc: Flat Two. 1961. Directed by Alan Cooke. Stars John Le Mesurier, Jack Watling & Barry Keegan. Two men visit the apartment of a rich gambler - Each with a strong motive for murder! [S]

programme.title: Colonel March of Scotland Yard

programme.title: Batman
programme.desc: Hot Off the Griddle. 1966. Stars Adam West & Julie Newmar. The thefts of a department store catalogue, a catamaran, and three mittens, alerts Batman and Robin that Catwoman is loose again. [S]

programme.title: Dial 999
programme.desc: Robbery With Violence. 1958. Stars Robert Beatty, Robert Rietty & Therese Burton. Maguire struggles to find leads when investigating an armed raid on a pawn-shop where a passer-by was killed. [S]

programme.title: Rumpole of the Bailey
programme.desc: Rumpole and the Eternal Triangle. Stars: Leo McKern, Marion Mathie, Peter Blythe. Rumpole finds himself defending a husband on a charge for murder.

programme.title: Love for Lydia
